title: Bug: geth shutdown may be ignored while synchronizing
body:
Hi,

#### System information

Geth version: any
OS & Version: Windows 10, NTFS

#### Expected behaviour

While geth is synchronizing, pressing ctrl-c should cause it to shutdown. Synchronization failure should not cause a retry while shutting down.

#### Actual behaviour

The last time I tried to close geth while synchronizing, it started to shut down, then said: 
```
WARN [12-10|11:01:11] Synchronisation failed, retrying         err="receipt download canceled (requested)"                                                
```
then happily began to continue downloading and did not exit even when I pressed ctrl-c again.
